title: Two Junior Product Developers
description:
We are now looking for two Junior Product Developers to join our Menswear team at GANT. As a Junior Product Developer, you will play a key role in bringing our design vision to life — supporting the entire product development process from the initial concept to final commercialization. You will work closely with the Category Product Developer & Designer to help ensure we deliver premium, high-quality, and commercially strong collections that meet both creative goals and business targets.
 



  





 We are looking for one person to focus on knitwear and one on jersey. Previous experience in either area is therefore considered an additional advantage.
 







  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* Support the development of products that meet our quality, pricing, and timing targets.
* Act as the vital link between design and suppliers, ensuring smooth communication and execution throughout the development process.
* Proactively source and develop high-quality and commercially viable products aligned with the product brief and range plan.
* Assist in price and lead-time negotiations with suppliers, ensuring final products align with category goals.
* Follow up on quality tests for materials, trims, and samples to uphold a consistently high-quality standard.
* Continuously monitor sales performance and market trends to ensure a competitive and relevant assortment.
* Support in developing products in the most sustainable way possible, in line with our sustainability goals.



  





**Profile** 



* University degree in textiles or a related field.
* Minimum 2 years of experience in a similar role, preferably within product development.
* Strong organizational and communication skills, with the ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced and deadline-driven environment.
* A flexible, proactive team player with a positive and passionate mindset.
* Fluent in spoken and written English.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, Google tools, and PLM systems.







  





 Apply with your CV in English by 2025/07/30. Our team reviews applications on a rolling basis, so seize the opportunity to join us by submitting your application today! Please note that this position may be filled before the set end date.
 



  





**About GANT** 




 GANT stands as an emblem of American Sportswear, symbolizing timeless style and innovation across 70+ global markets. As a company, we blend heritage with contemporary flair, crafting apparel for the bold, the curious, and the imaginative. Our brand represents more than fashion; it's a tradition of excellence and authenticity. As an employer, we foster a culture of continuous learning and creativity, inviting high performers to join our diverse team of innovators. At GANT, we're not just shaping the future of fashion; we're redefining what it means to dress with purpose and passion.

title: Software Design Engineer
description:
**Welcome!**
 Our Growth is Creating Great Opportunities!
   

  

 Our team is expanding, and we want to hire the most talented people we can. Continued success depends on it! Once you've had a chance to explore our current open positions, apply to the ones you feel suit you best and keep track of both your progress in the selection process, and new postings that might interest you!
   

  

 Thanks for your interest in working on our team!
   

  

 We are currently looking for a highly motivated
 **Software Design Engineer** 
 to join our Research and Development team in Stockholm, Sweden. If you want to be a part of our growing company that is driven by innovation and is focused on building a future together with our employees, consider applying.
   

  

 The key responsibilities of this role will include
   

  

* Design, implementation and test of hardware abstraction middleware and APIs
* Design, implementation and test of embedded software
* Design, implementation and test of forwarding plane software for switch and router functionality
* Documenting the design via Design Specifications and Reference Manuals


**General**
 Knowledge, skills and experience required
   

  

* Professional background in software development, preferably from large scale C/C++ development. End to end experience with designing, coding, testing, and maintaining code.
* Working experience from embedded software development within the field of communication protocols and data plane application development.
* Good understanding of data structures, algorithms, and complexity, and understanding of how to apply them to design pragmatic solutions.
* Experience with build and test systems, continuous integration (Jenkins, Buildbot, or similar), scripting (Python, Bash) and source control systems (preferably Git). Understanding of the value and usage of unit testing, test automation, and code generation.


**Required**
* MSc Computer Science or equivalent
* Demonstrable professional experience of SW development
* Experience from modern C/C++ programming
* Experience from Python programming
* Experience of TDD, Unit Testing and system level testing


**Desirable**
* Experience from data plane protocols and data plane application development
* Experience with CMake
* Strong Linux skills


 Scope of employment
   

  

* Fulltime / Permanent
* Office based


 Primary location(s) of job
   

  

* Stockholm, Sweden

title: Senior Fullstack Developer - Node
description:
**At Hemnet, we're in the midst of an exciting transformation — rebalancing our tech stack to better support the future of our products and teams. As part of this journey, we’re starting to expand our tech stack from our existing Ruby-based architecture to modern, scalable services built with Node.js.** 
  

  

 To accelerate this shift and strengthen our capabilities, we’re now investing in growing by hiring additional Node.js developers.
   

  

**What’s in it for you?** 
  

  

* 🧪 Innovative Approach: Work with an experimental and iterative approach. Dare to explore uncharted territories, try something new, and surprise us all!
* 🔄 End-to-End Development: Develop and maintain our products from idea to production
* 🫂 Inclusive Culture: Enjoy a friendly, inclusive, and caring company culture where transparency, work-life balance, and well-being are high priorities. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, ethnicity, or background
* ⚗️ Lab Weeks: Participate in recurring lab weeks—time for our developers to experiment, hack around, and evaluate creative ideas. Unleash Your Inner Mad Scientist—innovation starts here!
* 🛠️ Autonomy: Be part of a team that controls its own product decisions


  

  

**What you will do:** 
  

  

* Contribute to the continuous improvement of existing products and the development of new ones within the product team
* Collaborate closely with designers, product managers, and stakeholders to shape product vision and technical direction
* Participate in discussions and decisions related to architecture, implementation, and prioritization
* Take ownership of code quality, performance, and maintainability through testing, reviews, and refactoring
* Support and maintain production systems, ensuring reliability and stability
* Foster strong cross-functional relationships and actively contribute to a collaborative team culture
* Node.js Journey: Play a central role in our Node.js journey. While we have some services already running in production, this is just the beginning


  

  

**We believe you are:** 
  

  

 We see that you are an experienced developer with documented, commercial experience of working with the Node ecosystem. As our current architecture still includes Ruby components, we think that you are willing to learn and navigate the Ruby code base.
   

  

* Experience from data-driven product development with short iterations and experimentation
* Team Collaboration: Experience working in team settings, especially in medium to large multicultural/global companies
* Extensive experience and proficiency with other programming languages and eco systems. Meritorious frameworks: NestJS, Ruby on Rails, Typescript, React, and Next.js


  

  

**Your technical expertise likely includes several of the following areas:** 
  

  

* JavaScript – Proficiency in ES5, ES6+, and asynchronous programming
* Node.js – In-depth knowledge of Node.js and its ecosystem and frameworks (e.g., NestJS)
* Web Applications – Proven experience in driving architecture and system design, as well as developing and maintaining complex web-based applications in production environments
* RESTful APIs – Experience in designing and implementing RESTful APIs
* GraphQL – Familiarity with best practices for implementing and maintaining GraphQL APIs
* Database Management – Proficiency with relational databases such as PostgreSQL
* Cloud Services – Familiarity with AWS, Docker, and CircleCI, including deployment and scaling of Node.js services in cloud environments
* Testing and Debugging – Skilled in testing and debugging Node.js applications to ensure performance and reliabilit


  

  

**🏡 Your career at Hemnet** 
  

  

 With over 40 million visits each month, you’ll be part of Sweden’s most popular property platform – and one of the world’s most admired real estate platforms. But our size and reputation aren’t the only reasons why you and your 150+ colleagues enjoy working here.
   

  

 Since 1998, Hemnet has been an essential go-to place for millions of Swedes, guiding them through one of life’s biggest transitions: finding a new place to call home. We’re proud to make this life-changing, often stressful journey as seamless as possible.
   

  

 With access to vast amounts of data, you’ll have limitless opportunities to explore and create new features that enhance the experience for Sweden’s real estate agents, home buyers, and sellers.
   

  

 Our friendly Hemnet culture fosters a dynamic, playful environment where every voice is valued. Here, you’ll join a welcoming team that encourages you to thrive and grow, working alongside passionate colleagues from around the world.
   

  

**A Hybrid Way of Working** 
  

  

 Our vibrant office in central Stockholm is the hub of our collaboration and culture, providing a lively space that fosters team spirit. We come together in the office three days a week, with two flexible remote days. To be part of our team, it’s essential to be based in or near Stockholm.

title: Java Developer
description:

 **"Java Developer."**
 Our IT Delivery Center aims to build strong and sustainable solutions for customers across Europe. We are looking for a

title: Business Developer D365 Finance & Operations
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Jobbeskrivning**
**Vill du kombinera din tekniska expertis med affärsutveckling? Välkommen till Sopra Steria!**
 Är du en erfaren affärsutvecklare, funktionell konsult eller lösningsarkitekt inom Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations – och redo att ta nästa steg i karriären? Hos oss får du chansen att kombinera din tekniska kompetens med att utveckla affärer och kundrelationer i ett växande och engagerat team.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som vill vara med och forma framtiden för vårt Finance & Operations-erbjudande. Du blir en nyckelperson i vårt ERP-kluster, där du både arbetar i kunduppdrag och driver affärsutveckling, inklusive försäljning och anbudsarbete. Rollen innebär även en plats i den svenska ledningsgruppen för ERP-klustret – där din röst och dina idéer gör skillnad.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Du har gedigen erfarenhet av Dynamics 365 F&O och trivs i gränslandet mellan teknik och affär. Du är van att arbeta nära kund, identifiera behov och skapa lösningar som gör verklig skillnad. Du är också nyfiken, driven och vill vara med och utveckla både erbjudanden och arbetssätt.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har:
   

  

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet som funktionell konsult eller lösningsarkitekt inom F&O
* Erfarenhet av ISV-lösningar
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
* Dokumenterat framgångsrika implementationsprojekt (meriterande)
* Erfarenhet av konsultrollen, försäljning och affärsutveckling (meriterande)


**Om teamet**
 Vi är ett sammansvetsat ERP-team på cirka 30 personer med en jämn könsfördelning och en mix av juniora och seniora kollegor. Vi tror på kunskapsdelning, samarbete och att ha kul på vägen. Vår kultur präglas av öppenhet, engagemang och en stark vilja att utvecklas – tillsammans.
   

  

**Varför välja Sopra Steria?**
 Hos oss får du mer än bara ett jobb. Vi erbjuder:
   

  

* Frihet under ansvar och balans mellan arbete och fritid
* Stort fokus på din personliga utveckling
* En arbetsplats som rankats som en av Sveriges bästa av Great Place to Work – flera år i rad
* En ledande roll i Europas främsta digitaliseringskonsultbolag med global närvaro


**Låter det som något för dig?**
 Välkommen med din ansökan! Ladda upp ditt CV redan idag. Har du frågor? Kontakta gärna Business Owner Christer Söderholm christer.soderholm@soprasteria.com eller rekryterare Theresia Wiclander theresia.wiclander@soprasteria.com
   

  

 📍 Placering: Stockholm (hybrid)
   

  

 🕒 Omfattning: Heltid
   

  

 På Sopra Steria ställer vi höga krav på både kompetens och säkerhetsmedvetenhet hos våra medarbetare. Innan en eventuell anställning kommer du därför att genomgå en bakgrundskontroll, och vid intervju behöver du kunna uppvisa giltig legitimation.
   

  

 Urval och intervjuer sker löpande – skicka därför in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

**Ytterligare information**
 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Optimizely utvecklare
description:
Brinner du för utveckling och vill arbeta i en framåtsträvande miljö på ett av världens ledande konsultföretag? Vill du vara med och skapa nästa generations teknik och bygga den digitala framtiden? Brinner du för att leverera värde till människor globalt i våra projekt för några av världens största varumärken? Håller du dig ständigt uppdaterad i moderna ramverk, metoder och verktyg inom .NET-utveckling och Optimizely-plattformen?
   

  

 Om rollen
   

  

 Som .NET-utvecklare inom Optimizely/Episerver på Capgemini kommer du vara en del av ett högpresterande och agilt utvecklingsteam som arbetar med affärskritiska lösningar för våra kunder. Lösningarna nyttjar i största möjliga mån breda tekniska lösningar och tjänster i framkant från Microsoft och andra större partners. Detta innebär att du får en framtidssäkrad kompetens där du inte riskerar fastna i alltför specifika, smala och utdaterade lösningsområden.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta i framkant gällande testdriven utveckling och clean coding. Du får ett stort eget ansvar och kommer delta i alla utvecklingsfaser, från kravanalys och design till utveckling, test och leverans. I rollen kommer du att fokusera på nyskapande projekt med möjlighet att jobba med kollegor i Sverige och i andra länder. Du rapporterar till en av våra teamchefer och utgår från vårt kontor på Fleminggatan i Stockholm.
   

  

 Din profil
   

  

 Vi letar efter någon som med minst 3 års .NET-erfarenhet. Vi har en lång önskelista, men om följande tekniker låter intressanta för dig vill vi höra från dig:
   

  

* Optimizely CMS (fd Episerver)
* Erfarenhet från C#, .NET Core och Azure
* Azure Cloud, Kubernetes, Docker
* Azure CI/CD pipelines
* Service Bus, Rest APIs
* Erfarenhet eller intresse för ytterligare relevanta tekniker och ramverk som tex: MS SQL Server, Angular, React, Vue, MVC .Net 6, WCAG2.2, Optimizely Commerce


**Vad vi tror kommer få dig att trivas**
* Föräldraförmån
* Flexibla arbetsförhållanden & Work-from-Home Policy
* Guilds (Tech communities)
* Mentorskapsprogram (som mentor eller mentee)
* Delaktighet i Capgeminis olika fokusområden; Diversity and Inclusion, Sustainability, Wellness club, Art club etc.
* Generöst friskvårdsbidrag & tjänstepension
* Kompetensutveckling i form av utbildningar och certifieringar
* Roliga och inspirerande personalevent
* Företagshälsovård & sjukvårdsförsäkring


**Ansökan**
 Tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan. Vi kommer att intervjua löpande och ser fram emot att hitta vår nästa kollega. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

*Observera att identitets- och bakgrundskontroller kan genomföras som en del av rekryteringsprocessen.*
 Om Capgemini
   

  

 Capgemini är en global partner inom affärs- och tekniktransformation som hjälper organisationer att påskynda övergången till en digital och hållbar värld, och samtidigt gör skillnad för företag och samhälle. Det är en ansvarsfull och mångsidig organisation med 340 000 medarbetare i över 50 länder. Med ett starkt arv som sträcker sig över 55 år tillbaka har Capgemini sina kunders förtroende att hjälpa dem frigöra värdet av teknik för att tillgodose hela deras affärsbehov. Capgemini levererar helhetslösningar som utnyttjar styrkan från strategi och design till teknik. Allt drivet av en marknadsledande kapacitet inom AI, generativ AI, moln och data, kombinerat med en djup branschexpertis och ett ekosystem av partners. År 2024 rapporterade Capgemini Group globala intäkter på 22,1 miljarder euro.
   

  

 Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Battlefield Positive Play: Software Engineer
description:
**Description & Requirements**
 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.
   

  

 The Battlefield Positive Play team is dedicated to protecting our titles by mitigating the impact of bad actors. We collaborate with partner teams to create new services and initiatives that ensure our players enjoy a fair and positive gaming experience. Join us in keeping Battlefield fair and equitable, now and into the future.
   

  

**Summary**
 Are you passionate about games and developing innovative and robust solutions that secure the integrity of game experiences? Do you have the skills and experience to work with cross-functional leaders and analysts to design and implement game logic and innovative tools to detect and prevent cheating, toxicity, exploitation, and other disruptive behaviors? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you!
   

  

 As a Software Engineer within the Battlefield Game Development team, you will be responsible for creating and maintaining game logic and tools that protect the game from bad actors and ensure a fair and fun gaming environment for all players. You will use various technologies and methods to prevent and detect cheaters, hackers, exploiters, griefers, and other disruptive players.
   

  

 You will collaborate with the Game Ops Positive Play team, cross-functional Battlefield leaders, and other EA teams to take appropriate actions to maintain a safe, fair, and competitive Battlefield experience.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Create and maintain game logic and tools that protect the game from bad actors and ensure a safe, fair, and fun gaming environment for all players across cheat, toxicity, and UGX vectors.
* Use various technologies and methods to prevent and detect cheaters, hackers, exploiters, griefers, and other disruptive players, such as encryption, obfuscation, hashing, anti-debugging, anti-tampering, etc.
* Develop processes, tools, and systems to act on verified bad actors according to Battlefield defined measures.
* Document and escalate cases of confirmed bad actors to the appropriate teams for further action.
* Work with the Game Integrity Lead (Product Role) to communicate and coordinate with other teams within EA, such as other game teams (e.g., Apex, FC), Security, Data, Legal, Customer Support, and Community Management, to ensure a consistent and effective approach to positive play enforcement.
* Work across the Game Ops team to provide feedback and suggestions to improve the game's integrity through security, moderation, anti-toxicity, and anti-cheat systems, as well as the policies and procedures for positive play enforcement.


**Requirements**
* 4+ years of experience in software engineering, game development, or online gaming enforcement, preferably in AAA and/or FPS development.
* Familiarity with online gaming platforms, services, and technologies, such as EA Play, Steam, Xbox Live, PSN, Easy Anti-Cheat, etc.
* Knowledge of common cheating, hacking, exploiting, and griefing methods and tools used in online games, as well as the countermeasures and solutions to prevent and detect them.
* Modding experience and familiarity with the communities and tools involved.
* Proficiency in programming languages, such as C++, C#, Java, Python, etc.
* Excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills.
* Passion for gaming and positive play.


**About Electronic Arts**
 We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.
   

  

 We adopt a holistic approach to our benefits programs, emphasizing physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life. Our packages are tailored to meet local needs and may include healthcare coverage, mental well-being support, retirement savings, paid time off, family leaves, complimentary games, and more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.
   

  

 Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

title: Golang Developer
description:
**Are you our next Golang Developer?** 




 Come join us at Kivra! We’re looking for people with a passion for software development, love solving problems, and that thrive in agile development environments. We are building services that connect over 6 million people, by providing a safe and accessible digital infrastructure that everyone in Sweden can trust and use. At the same time, we are saving trees - reducing the paper that is printed and transported - by providing a better digital alternative to physical paper communication.
 



  





**What you’ll be doing** 




 As a Golang Developer on our retail team, you’ll help build scalable products and develop new and existing features to serve our growing base of merchants and users. Security, reliability, and scalability are at the core of everything you do.
 



 Our services deal with large amounts of users, data and transactions daily, and our objective is to do so with 100% availability. We believe in doing things smart, simple and open source - and this is reflected in our tech stack.
 



 Moreover, we have adopted the Devops Methodology and strongly believe in the “You build it - you own it”-attitude. You will be actively involved in developing, testing, deploying and incident management, contributing to the overall success of the team. In that regard we utilize Docker, Kubernetes, PostgreSQL, GCP, Kafka, Github, and more.
 



  





**What we’re looking for** 




 Knowledge is important but so is attitude! Kivra’s culture is strongly influenced by kindness, drive and the desire to produce high-quality work. How you fit in with your team is super important, and just like us, we believe that you thrive on being nice, helpful and always encouraging growth.
 



  





**Moreover we believe that you:** 



* Design and build scalable, reliable, and secure features in Go
* Are a doer that gets excited about developing new ideas and proposing innovative solutions.
* Use feedback and reflection to develop self-awareness, personal and professional strengths as well as address new development areas
* Can collaborate with other product teams to help and provide the best end-user experience
* Review your work and that of others for quality, accuracy and relevance
* Use straightforward feedback, in a structured and constructive way, when communicating with others
* Embrace a DevOps culture with a
 *“you build it, you own it”* 
 mindset
* Seek opportunities to automate and document your work



  





 Moreover, we value previous experience in agile methodology and that you enjoy working within all aspects of agile development. To solve problems we strive to pair-program when possible and we think that you have the same mindset. Just like us, you are passionate about your craft and take ownership over your own development.
 



  





**We offer** 




 Kivra offers a role in a caring and committed team, in a company that is growing and continuously innovating. You’ll join a warm and friendly culture that thrives on collaboration and teamwork. You will be involved in shaping and influencing a product currently used by more than half of Sweden’s population.
 



 We offer competitive remuneration and great benefits. Read more about our core values and benefits here: https://jobs.kivra.dev/!
 



  





**How to apply** 




 Easy peasy, just send in your CV and cover letter as soon as possible. If you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact Sarah Ohlsson, Talent Acquisition Partner at sarah.ohlsson@kivra.com!

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

**The Data Platform Team**
 The Data Platform Team at Mentimeter builds data infrastructure and services that influence the future path of the company. The team is part of the Catalyst organization and collaborates closely with the Data and Analytics organization which consists of other embedded and central teams of data scientists, analysts and insight people. Here, you’ll be working on a data ecosystem that serves all of the departments (Product, Marketing, Sales and Finance) with both data as well as infrastructure. You will have a direct impact on the future of Mentimeter’s business and product decisions.
   

  

 As a Senior Data Engineer, you will be involved in architecting and building data platforms to tackle business and technical use cases. We currently use AWS with technologies such as Snowflake, Prefect, dbt, Terraform, Postgres, ECS, Python, TypeScript, Hex and Looker. We are always exploring new technologies and you would also be part of the next leap in data platform maturity. Initially your team will consist of a Lead and two Data Engineers.
   

  

 Further enriching our vision is the emerging potential of Large Language Models (LLMs) and Generative AI. The synergy between LLMs and Mentimeter is a match made in the heavens. We anticipate lots of opportunities in which AI could profoundly influence the evolution of our product and our internal operations. In your capacity as a Senior Data Engineer, you would play a critical role in building the foundations that would fuel this future, with data.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Architect, integrate and maintain batch and stream data pipelines between operational and analytical databases as well as third party systems.
* Collaborate with product developers, analytics engineers and data scientists to deliver new data features within the data warehouse or other systems.
* Provide contextual and best-practice level contributions to the Data Engineering team from a technical standpoint and ensure proper and scalable architectural decisions and life cycle.
* Collaborate with analytics engineers to validate and ensure high data quality.
* Maintain a performant data warehouse.


**We Believe You Have**
* 5-8 years of previous experience working as a data engineer, data heavy backend developer or similar.
* Experience of software engineering and programming (Python, SQL, Java, Scala) in a professional environment.
* Experience building and maintaining a data platform in AWS.
* Proficient knowledge of architecture and design (patterns, reliability, scalability, quality) of systems.
* Ability to think strategically to assess priorities, possible solution alternatives and understand trade-offs before committing to a way forward.
* Experience with fast prototyping.
* Good communication and pedagogical skills.
* Comfortable communicating with a diverse set of technical and business stakeholders in English, especially written (daily work is carried out in English and the Mentimeter team currently boasts 50+ different nationalities).


**It Is Beneficial If You Have**
* Experience with Data warehouse systems in cloud environments such as AWS, GCP or Azure.
* Experience with Snowflake.
* Experience with GDPR compliance requirements around data in transit and data at rest.
* Experience with stream processing and real time systems.
* Experience with ML engineering.
* Professional experience working in an agile environment.
* Experience with attracting, finding and growing talented professionals


 Not sure you meet 100% of our qualifications? Please apply anyway and let us know why you would enjoy working in this role at Mentimeter!
   

  

 Please note that this role will have its base in our Stockholm office and is primarily an onsite role with the opportunity to work from home twice per week.
   

  

 Learn more about Our Ways of Working - Guiding Principles by clicking here.
   

  

 Please note: We’re on summer vacation and will review all applications and get back to you in August. Thanks for your patience and enjoy the summer!
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Finnish speaking Business Developer – Stockholm (Sweden)
Danish speaking Business Developer – Stockholm (Sweden)
People & Performance manager
description:
**Job Description**
 People & Performance manager
   

  

**This is Worldline**
 Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.
   

  

**The O** 
**pportunity**
 We are looking for an upbeat People & Performance Manager to join our leadership team. The product domain is Digital Experience where we work closely with all customers facing digital services for Worldline. During your journey here you will get to know talented software engineering and product team based in Stockholm to help further strengthen empowered culture we strive to shape as well as contribute to their individual growth and performance. In this role you will work closely together with our Tech and Product directors in the Digital Experience leadership team.
   

  

 In this role as performance manager, you will be working with software engineers and product roles to create an environment where they can consistently meet and exceed the company standards while working towards their personal goals. This would also mean offering feedback, coaching and recognition for achievements and success. In this role you are not expected to contribute to the tech or product strategy as your product is the people performance itself.
   

  

**The team**
 The Digital Experience team is like a football team that requires coaching to create the high performing players and a team to win the game. This is the role of the leadership team you will be part of where all of us are different type of coaches to provide either product strategy, direction for the game to play and players that can be motivated and focused to the goal of winning as a team.
   

  

**Day-to-Day Responsibilities**
* Establishing job functions and expectations
* Improving employee abilities through coaching and feedback
* Establishing employee behaviour patterns that align their goals with the organisations mission, values and goals
* Improving communication throughout the organisation
* Providing factual basis for management decisions regarding hiring
* Conducting the hiring process e2e
* Ensuring onboarding and mentorship structure is in place
* Setting performance objectives
* Ensuring everyone in the team is contributing best to its expectations


**Who Are We Looking For**
 People who have a professional approach, being constructive and finding solutions in the best interest of the business. You are a quick learner and self-starting, showing drive and initiatives supporting business goals. A great teammate who supports their team and puts the business objectives first. You also have:
   

  

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering, or another related field.
* Proven experience in people management
* Previous experience working as developer is seen as beneficial.
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to connect with both technical and non-technical colleagues.
* Strong analytical skills to effectively process and structure large amounts of information.


**Perks & Benefits**
 At Worldline, you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:
   

  

* Health contribution
* Health check – Every 2:nd year
* Private Health Care Insurance (EuroAccident)
* Parental pay and 12 months pension during parental leave
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard
* Benefit portal with many great offers, plus more.


**Shape the evolution**
 We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries, and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.
   

  

**Learn more about life at Worldline at** 
**jobs.worldline.com**
**We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.**

title: ASIC Verification Engineer - UVM
description:
**Job Description**
**Are you an ASIC-verification engineer with deep** 
***UVM-knowledge***
**looking for your next challenge?**
**Do you want to be part a flexible company with multiple opportunities?**
**Would you like to participate in exciting cutting-edge projects?**
 In that case we have the right position for you! We are currently expanding existing teams to contribute in bringing bright ideas and complex designs to life. Therefor we are looking for skilled ASIC-verification engineers
 *in UVM* 
 to join us and be part of successful a group. You will be involved in new and existing ASIC projects within telecom.
   

  

 Keywords: ASIC, Verilog, FPGA, Developer, Embedded Systems, Consulting, Consultant, Design System Architect, Verification, lab, SystemVerilog, UVM.
   

  

**Qualifications**
 In all our recruitments we attach great importance to personal qualities. If you can recognize yourself in our key values - BRAVE, DEVOTED, TEAM PLAYERS - maybe we're the employer you are looking for?
   

  

 We think that you have good cooperation skills and that you like to take responsibility!
   

  

 Preferably you already reside in Sweden, but for the right talent we offer a relocation package to move to Stockholm with your family.
   

  

**Knowledge And Experience**
* You have a solid background with more than 3+ years of experience of ASIC verification
* Good command of UVM verification and SystemVerilog
* Used to work with complex ASIC and/or large FPGA design
* Experience from IP block verification
* Multi clock domains
* Good English skills, in both speech and writing


**Meritorious If You Have**
* RTL design within Verilog, VHDL and/or SystemVerilog
* Leadership qualities
* Scripting skills
* Lab experience

**Company Description**
 AFRY is a European leader in engineering, design, and advisory services, with a global reach. We accelerate the transition towards a sustainable society.
   

  

 We are 19,000 devoted experts in infrastructure, industry, energy and digitalisation, creating sustainable solutions for generations to come.
   

  

 Making Future.
   

  

 Additional Information

* Access to Club AFRY & AFRY Cottages


**Contact Information**
**Maja Lindqvist**
 Recruitment Partner
   

  

 maja.lindqvist@afry.com
   

  

**Jihad Daoud**
 Section Manager
   

  

 jihad.daoud@afry.com

That’s how we're making future. We are actively looking for qualified candidates to join our inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. Join us in accelerating the transition towards a sustainable future.*

title: Salesforceutvecklare inom Kundplattform & CRM till Handelsbanken
description:
***Vill du vara med och utveckla
 *vår CRM-plattform som stöttar medarbetare på bankens mötesplatser?**
 Vi söker en erfaren Salesforce utvecklare som vill vara med på vår implementation av Salesforce.**
**Ditt team**
 Du kommer bli en del av ett av Handelsbankens Salesforce team. Teamet består av Salesforce utvecklare, Business Analyst, Testare, Agil Product Owner och Team Coach. Tillsammans ansvarar teamet för att leverera funktionalitet som stödjer Handelsbankens kundplattform och CRM-lösning baserad på Salesforce. Vi arbetar i tvärfunktionella agila team och du kommer samarbeta nära utvecklare och arkitekter, inom och utanför vårt område. Vi har roligt på jobbet och vårt team präglas av hög kompetens och bred erfarenhet inom både teknik och affärsverksamhet.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Som Salesforce utvecklare kommer du att vara en del av ett högpresterande team där innovation och problemlösning står i fokus. Du kommer tillsammans med teamet ta fram och utveckla tekniska lösningar enligt Salesforce best practise. Vi arbetar med den senaste teknologi-stacken från Salesforce och vi drivs av att testa nya saker och se hur vi kan ta in dessa i våra leveranser. Teamet kommer översätta strategiska verksamhetsmål (Epics, Features) till IT-lösningar, säkerställa riskhantering och att lösningar uppfyller regelverks efterlevnad, samt säkerställa kvalitet och effektivitet på leveranser.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som är utvecklare och har gedigen erfarenhet av utveckling och implementation av Salesforce. Du kan arbeta självständigt och har djup förståelse och erfarenhet av olika Salesforce produkter. Vidare har du erfarenhet av att designa och utveckla användarorienterade, effektiva, och skalbara Salesforce applikationer enligt bästa praxis i den senaste tekniken. Då vi samarbetar med hela koncernen behöver du behärska god svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Vi söker även dig som har:
   

  

* erfarenhet av att implementera Lightning Components, Flows, Apex Controllers, Batch Apex, Schedulers och Apex Triggers
* kunskap om att integrera Salesforce med externa applikationer med hjälp av tredjepartsverktyg via SOAP och REST API-integration
* certifieringar inom Salesforce tex Salesforce Administrator, Plattform Developer 1, Sales cloud och Service cloud
* varit involverad i större implementeringar av Salesforce i en stor organisation


 Som person strävar du efter att arbeta tillsammans med ditt team och ta tillvara på kollegors olika perspektiv för att nå uppsatta mål. Du anpassar din kommunikation till målgruppen och har ett pedagogiskt förhållningssätt i att vägleda och motivera andra. Det kommer naturligt att tänka i nya banor för att komma till skalbara lösningar. Du håller dig uppdaterad kring det senaste inom ditt område och omvärldsbevakar för att söka efter bästa möjliga lösningar.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
**Vi erbjuder**
* en trygg och stabil arbetsgivare
* dynamiskt och stimulerande arbete
* work-life balance
* kompetens- och karriärutveckling
* inkluderande- och jämställd arbetsmiljö
* konkurrenskraftigt förmånspaket


**Kontaktuppgifter**
**Rekryterande chef:**
 Fredrik Rutberg, fredrik.rutberg@handelsbanken.se & Ann-Chistine Stålfors, ann-christine.stalfors@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**TA Partner:** 
 Alva Jonerot, alva.jonerot@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**Facklig representant Finansförbundet:**
 Per Almshult, per.almshult@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**Facklig representant Akademikerföreningen:**
 Paul Gutesten, paul.gutesten@handelsbanken.se

 Keywords: ASIC, Verilog, FPGA, Developer, Embedded Systems, Consulting, Consultant, Design System Architect, Verification, lab, SystemVerilog, UVM.

 In all our recruitments we attach great importance to personal qualities. If you can recognize yourself in our key values - BRAVE, DEVOTED, TEAM PLAYERS - maybe we're the employer you are looking for?
   

  

 We think that you have good cooperation skills and that you like to take responsibility!
   

  

 Preferably you already reside in Sweden, but for the right talent we offer a relocation package to move to Stockholm with your family.
   

  

 Knowledge and experience:
   

  

* You have a solid background with more than 3+ years of experience of ASIC verification
* Good command of UVM verification and SystemVerilog
* Used to work with complex ASIC and/or large FPGA design
* Experience from IP block verification
* Multi clock domains
* Good English skills, in both speech and writing


 Meritorious if you have:
   

  

* RTL design within Verilog, VHDL and/or SystemVerilog
* Leadership qualities
* Scripting skills
* Lab experience
* Telecommunication


**Additional Information**
* Permanent position
* 28 days annual leave
* Collective agreement
* Pension
* Competence development
* Health care allowance
* Access to Club AFRY & AFRY Cottages


**Contact information:**
**Maja Lindqvist**
 Recruitment Partner
   

  

 maja.lindqvist@afry.com
   

  

**Jihad Daoud**
 Section Manager
   

  

 jihad.daoud@afry.com
   

  

*At AFRY, we engineer change in everything we do. Change happens when brave ideas come together. When we collaborate, innovate technology, and embrace challenging points of view. That’s how we're making future. We are actively looking for qualified candidates to join our inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. Join us in accelerating the transition towards a sustainable future.*

title: Developer, Informatica
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Business Consulting and Services
description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.
   

  

 At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story: we are looking for an Informatica Data Management Cloud Administrator to join our team in Sweden.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Cognizant collaborates with all major hyperscale’s and relevant software vendors in the data and AI space. This includes partnerships with industry leaders such as AWS, Microsoft, Google, Snowflake, and Databricks. Our comprehensive approach ensures that we leverage the best tools and technologies to deliver scalable, secure, and efficient solutions. Additionally, we are supported locally by our dedicated Centres of Excellence, which operate both nearshore and offshore. These centres provide specialized expertise and resources, ensuring that we can meet the unique needs of our clients and drive innovation in AI and data cost effectively.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The Informatica Developer will work closely with data analysts, business analysts, and other IT professionals to create and maintain data solutions that ensure efficient and accurate data integration and management. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with Informatica tools and a strong understanding of ETL processes.
   

  

**Your Key Result Areas**
* Design, develop, and maintain ETL/ELT workflows using Informatica IDMC tools
* Integrate data from various sources into cloud data warehouses (e.g., Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery)
* Configure and manage Secure Agents for job execution and monitoring
* Develop and deploy data quality rules and validation processes
* Implement data cataloging and metadata management for improved data discovery
* Build and consume REST/SOAP APIs for data exchange and automation
* Collaborate with data architects, analysts, and business users to understand data requirements
* Troubleshoot and optimize data pipelines for performance and reliability
* Ensure compliance with data governance and security policies
* Document technical designs, workflows, and best practices


**Requirements**
* Informatica IDMC Tools: Proficiency in Data Integration, Cloud Data Quality, and Cloud Application Integration
* ETL/ELT Development: Experience designing and building data pipelines and transformation logic
* Cloud Platforms: Familiarity Azure for cloud-native data workflows
* Secure Agent Configuration: Knowledge of deploying and managing Secure Agents
* Data Cataloging: Experience with metadata ingestion, data lineage, and classification
* API Integration: Working with REST/SOAP APIs for data exchange and automation
* Scripting Languages: Basic scripting in Python, Shell, or PowerShell for automation tasks
* SQL and Data Modeling: Strong SQL skills and understanding of relational and non-relational databases
* Version Control: Proficiency with Git for source code and workflow management
* Debugging and Optimization: Ability to troubleshoot data jobs and optimize performance
