title: Senior Product Owner Edge Platform (9092)
description:
We are a global leader in industrial manufacturing of dairy equipment, with decades of heritage building world-class dairy equipment—robots, compressors, pumps, motors, gates, embedded systems, and much more. Now, we’re transforming for the future.

Our Digital Services team is leading this transformation by connecting our vast installed base of on-site equipment to secure, scalable cloud services. This is not just a technical shift—it’s a foundational change in how we support, service, and innovate for our customers across the world.  


**Role and responsibilities**

We are seeking a Technical Product Owner to define and drive the vision for a unified Edge Platform. This platform will consolidate and modernize our on-premise compute, storage, and networking systems across our globally distributed equipment base. You’ll ensure these edge systems are cloud-managed, secure, scalable, and supply-chain integrated—built for the future of connected industry. This role sits within the Digital Services unit, but requires tight collaboration with our manufacturing and embedded systems business unit. You will act as a strategic and technical bridge—aligning embedded systems, field deployed hardware, cloud architecture, and customer-facing digital services.  


**Key Responsibilities**
* Own the Edge Platform roadmap, driving the harmonization of all onprem compute, storage, and networking infrastructure across our product lines.
* Translate customer and business requirements into clear, actionable user stories and backlogs for engineering teams.
* Collaborate with globally distributed embedded, hardware, and cloud teams and partners to ensure seamless edge-to-cloud integration.
* Define and prioritize product features around security, manageability, scalability, and cost-efficiency.
* Develop and evangelize standards around disk encryption, secure boot, OTA updates, remote monitoring, and identity and access management for edge infrastructure.
* Ensure the platform supports end-to-end supply chain integration, enabling customers to digitally order, ship, track, install, monitor, and service their equipment.
* Interface with partners like AWS to maximize our use of edge technologies (e.g., Greengrass, IoT Core)

  


**Required Qualifications**
* 5+ years of experience in technical product ownership or architecture for IoT, edge computing, or embedded platforms.
* Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional initiatives, and balance competing priorities across business units.
* Ideally you have gained hands-on experience in your previous roles in one or more of the following technologies:
	+ Linux (Yocto, embedded variants)
	+ Kubernetes, containerized workloads at the edge
	+ AWS IoT services (Greengrass, IoT Core)
	+ Embedded cybersecurity (disk encryption, secure boot, TPMs, certificates)
	+ Network and distributed system architecture
* Experience working with manufacturing teams or complex physical products

  

**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience in device fleet management and software lifecycle in industrial environments
* Knowledge of industrial networking protocols (e.g. ModBus, OPCUA, CANOpen) and legacy system integration.
* Familiarity with digital supply chain integration for physical product workflows (order to ship to install to service).
* Strong understanding of regulatory and compliance aspects of cybersecurity for connected equipment.
* Certified AWS Solutions Architect Professional, preferably with a specialty certification in Security or Network Administration or both. CCNA/CCNP or CKA certifications preferred.

  


**Working at DeLaval**

Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behaviour. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviours: Set Direction, Make Things Happen and One DeLaval.  

We offer you a workplace like no other, where state-of-the-art technology goes hand in hand with animal welfare. DeLaval is a part of the Tetra Laval Group together with Tetra Pak and Sidel.  


**Additional information:**  

This is a full-time permanent position that can be based in Tumba (Sweden), Wroclaw (Poland), or Krakow (Poland), depending on the candidate’s location and preference.  

We offer a hybrid workplace model, allowing flexibility to work remotely.

We review applications ongoing. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact us. During the holiday period, it may take some time before you hear from us.  


**Contact:**  

Hiring manager: Yvo Bogers, yvo.borgers@delaval.com  

Recruiter: Agnes Edbom, agnes.edbom@delaval.com  

  

**About DeLaval:**  

Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.  

Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group. See more at corporate.delaval.com.
company_addresses: Gustaf De Lavals väg 15, 147 21 Tumba, Sweden
company_description: At DeLaval, We Live Milk!

title: Head of Contracting Nordics
description:
**Who are WebBeds?**



WebBeds is the fastest growing and most significant accommodation supplier to the travel industry. We are a global company offering ground services (hotels, transfers, tours, activities) to travel professionals. Our products help our partners and customers to create amazing Travel experiences.



Our Products range from a Retail Online platform, Integration Connectivity hub and distribution APIs to name but a few and our systems are 100% cloud hosted processing up to 5.0bn search requests daily. We deliver amazing outcomes using leading edge technology through innovative and creative thinking.



WebBeds is a subsidiary of Web Travel Group (ASX: WEB) – an ASX 200 listed company operating a global digital travel business.

 **What makes us stand out?**


* We are a wholesale global travel organization
* We have 1500+ people speaking 50+ languages in 120+ cites across 50+ countries
* We partner with over 430,000 properties in more than 15,000 destinations
* We work with more than 44,000 travel companies in 139 source markets
* We have an amazing Technology team focused on delivering valuable outcomes using innovative tech and creative & lateral thinking

 **What will you do on your journey with WebBeds?**



WebBeds is the world’s fastest growing provider of accommodation distribution services to the travel industry. Our products incorporate distribution APIs, payment integrations, ERP integration, Data Lakes, User Interfaces, and others. Our search API reach peaks of more than 50.000 requests per second, each one consisting of tens or hundreds of hotels, with continued expansion.



"We design, deliver and support innovative solutions through engagement, collaboration and a fearsome passion for creating customer value" is our mission as an IT organization.



With this in mind, we strive to be at the leading edge of technology when it comes to build the platform that meets the needs of our Supply partners and customers. This translates to the use of latest technology including .NET Core versions, K8S, microservices architecture, clouds hosting and orchestration, CI/CD pipelines, automated testing, Proactive monitoring, and alerting systems, to name a few.



Our delivery teams have the creativity and freedom to express themselves by building innovative solutions to often complex problems and are challenged to reach higher levels daily. Our teams consist of product owners, QA engineers, Software Engineers, and people from across the business all working collectively and collaboratively. We have a very strong technical team from which you will be able to learn but are encouraged by new ideas and fresh thinking that you will bring with you.

 **In this Role you will:**



Lead the day-to-day operations of the Nordic contracting team, overseeing both individual performance and team-wide delivery. You’ll coach and support Contract Managers, set performance targets, and foster a culture of collaboration and growth. Simultaneously, you will manage a personal portfolio of hotel partnerships, negotiating contracts and securing competitive terms. You will build and maintain strong relationships with hotel chains, monitor regional trends, and proactively respond to market needs. Acting as a strategic link between internal stakeholders and external suppliers, you’ll ensure high product quality, optimize supplier performance, and contribute directly to WebBeds’ commercial objectives.

  

**Key Responsibilities**


* Lead and manage the regional team to ensure all members meet their KPIs and objectives. Support performance through regular monitoring, open feedback, and by fostering a culture of innovation and proactivity.
Conduct regular one-to-one meetings to maintain strong two-way communication:  
* 

- With team members: Review performance, align on short-, medium-, and long-term goals, conduct pre- and post-business trip briefings, and take corrective actions as needed to maximise results.


* With the Vice President of Northern Europe: Share updates on individual and team performance, discuss trading improvements, flag challenges, and collaborate on solutions. Seek guidance when necessary.


* Support recruitment activities within the department as required.
* Set high standards and enhance the team’s commercial capability. Identify development needs and support individual growth through coaching, mentoring, and training. Accompany team members on business trips where appropriate to provide in-the-field support.
* Ensure the team is fully familiar with key procurement tools and requirements relevant to the region, including connectivity and channel manager usage.
* Empower the team to manage and strengthen commercial relationships with hotel partners, including key regional chains, working closely with internal stakeholders such as Reservations, Sales, Revenue, and Accounts.
* Promote strong internal communication by sharing successful contracting initiatives and flagging any destination-related issues with relevant departments in a timely manner.
* Deliver against annual departmental and individual KPIs and objectives.
* Negotiate and secure competitive contracts that meet company requirements for rates, allocations, overrides, and other key commercial terms within your assigned area.
* Regularly analyse production data to ensure sufficient inventory aligned with destination performance targets.
* Optimise contract performance by securing tactical promotions and special offers to drive competitiveness and sales.
* Ensure timely re-contracting of existing hotels in line with agreed renewal cycles and business timelines.
* Identify and prioritise contracting of ‘must-have’ hotels to enhance regional portfolio strength.
* Lead strategic negotiations and partnership management with key hotel chains to maximise market share and long-term collaboration.
* Plan and carry out in-year contracting trips to secure renewals and sign new properties, aligned with personal and team targets.
* Negotiate added-value offers and exclusive deals to support revenue growth and distribution advantage.
* Monitor competitor pricing and availability, responding to market demand and trends proactively.
* Proactively address supplier-related service level issues, ensuring high standards of delivery.
* Conduct regular hotel inspections and ensure up-to-date, accurate product content (e.g., amenities, photos, facilities).
* Share relevant destination intelligence internally, including peak travel dates, local events, and trade shows.
* Take responsibility for mitigating commercial losses through proactive negotiation and issue resolution.
* Identify underperforming hotels and implement actions to improve or replace them as appropriate.

  



**The skills we would love to see in your suitcase!**


* Minimum 5 years’ experience in hotel contracting and team management.
* Proven track record in hotel partnerships and commercial performance within the Nordics market.
* Demonstrated experience in managing relationships with major hotel chains in the region.
* Strong negotiation and relationship-building skills.
* Proactive leadership style with the ability to develop and motivate teams.
* High attention to detail and accuracy.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in English; fluency in one or more Nordic languages is an advantage.
* Comfortable working under pressure and focused on achieving results.
* Solid working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
* Confident team leadership and delegation.
* Target-driven mindset.
* Strong internal and external communication.
* Effective stakeholder management.
* Willingness to travel within the region.

 **Why choose us as your next destination?**



We are super proud of our dedicated team of friendly, energetic & passionate professionals. Our people are key to the success of our business & everybody at WebBeds has their own unique role to play as we continue to drive the company forward.



Over 50 different languages are spoken by our workforce, but whether working from offices in Dubai or London or out in the field in Johannesburg or Buenos Aires, we all share the common goal to take pride in what we do & to deliver our partners with unbeatable service & support.


International highly skilled group of experts from all around the globe
Dynamic environment with the chance to grow, influence & impact change
Disruptive, fast-growing market leader within travel & endless possibilities
Culture built on collaboration empowerment and innovation
  

Find out more about the WebBeds business at www.webbeds.com - **#LI-Hybrid**

title: Projektingenjör
description:
**Om tjänsten**
---------------


Roll:**Övriga tjänstemän**
Ansök senast:**2025-08-03**
Var:**Luleå**  



Projektingenjör


**Vill du alltid bli bättre? Får du energi av omväxling och snabbt tempo i en vänlig miljö? På Bravida är vi teknikproffs som gör jobbet ordentligt. Vi kan ta oss ann spännande uppdrag som få andra företag klarar. Nu söker vi en projektingenjör till vår verksamhet i Luleå. Välkommen med din ansökan!**
**Ditt nya jobb**



Rollen som projektingenjör på Bravida innebär att du arbetar som stöd till projektet och projektledare och har en stor och varierande roll i arbetsgruppen. Du kommer ha en central nyckelroll i teamet och fungera som navet mellan teknik, ekonomi och planering. Du kommer arbeta fritt under ansvar och du kommer få möjligheten att arbeta med stora komplexa projekt där de personliga utvecklingsmöjligheterna är många.



Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer bland annat att bestå av:


* Säkerställa kvalitet av planering, beredning, risk- och möjligheter genom projektets olika faser
* Kvalitetssäkra underlag för ÄTA, hinder och störning och hantera avvikelser
* Säkerställa en tydlig, detaljerad och spårbar Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) som ligger till grund för både planering och ekonomisk uppföljning.
* Upprätta och följa upp tidplaner, resursplaner, inköpsplaner utifrån produktionskalkyler
* Uppföljning av inköp via avtal, underentreprenörer etc.
* Uppföljning, prognoshantering och redovisning av projektekonomi

  


**Vi söker dig som har**


* Relevant akademisk examen (t.ex. civilingenjör, industriell ekonomi, bygg- eller installationsteknik)
* God kunskap inom projektplaneringsverktyget Primavera Cloud / Primavera P6
* Goda färdigheter inom MS Excel
* Stark förståelse för projektekonomi, kalkyl, uppföljning och rapportering
* Erfarenhet av WBS-strukturering och ÄTA-processer
* Flytande svenska och god engelska i tal och skrift
* Förmåga att arbeta strukturerat, självständigt och lösningsorienterat

  



Som person är du strukturerad och noggrann, med en stark förmåga att arbeta med komplexa finansiella data. Du är självständig och initiativrik, vilket ger dig en hög problemlösningsförmåga. Samtidigt är du teamorienterad och kommunikativ, med en naturlig förmåga att samarbeta effektivt med olika avdelningar och intressenter. Vi ser även att du är resultatorienterad, stresstålig, och har en god förmåga att hålla deadlines även i en snabb och krävande arbetsmiljö.


**Bravida som arbetsgivare**



På Bravida är vi stolta över att leverera känslan när allt bara fungerar. Våra medarbetare har byggt förtroende hos våra kunder sedan 1922 och är hjärtat i vår organisation. Tillsammans levererar vi de mest energieffektiva tekniska lösningarna. Hos oss har du möjlighet att göra skillnad för en mer hållbar framtid. Vi värdesätter mångfald och strävar efter att skapa en säker och inkluderande arbetsplats där alla känner sig välkomna och uppskattade. Din säkerhet kommer först, alltid.



Genom våra interna utbildningar erbjuder vi utvecklingsmöjligheter, och i vår starka gemenskap hjälper vi varandra att lyckas. Som en del av vårt team får du chansen att utvecklas både personligt och professionellt. Vi är stolta över att vara ett av Nordens ledande företag inom vår bransch, vilket ger oss möjlighet att erbjuda förmåner som exempelvis förmånliga pensionsavtal, friskvårdsbidrag och vidareutbildning. Läs mer om hur det är att arbeta på Bravida här.


**Hur söker jag jobbet?**



Ansökningar hanteras efter annonsens sista ansökningsdatum som är **3 augusti 2025**. Du skickar in ditt CV genom


*Vi undanber oss kontakt med rekryteringsföretag i denna rekryteringsprocess.*
company_description: Bravida är Nordens ledande leverantör av helhetslösningar för service och installation av el, vs, ventilation och andra tekniska funktioner i fastigheter och anläggningar.

title: Segment & Automation Specialist
description:
**Job Description**  

We are seeking a **Segment & Automation Specialist** to join our global marketing analytics team at H&M. This role is ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of data, technology, and customer experience. You’ll be responsible for building and managing customer segmentation strategies and marketing automation workflows that power personalized, data-driven campaigns across multiple channels.  

  

**WHAT YOU’LL DO**  

As a Segment & Automation Specialist, you will play a central role in how we activate customer data across our marketing ecosystem. Your key responsibilities will include:

* Develop and maintain customer audiences to support targeted marketing and CRM initiatives.
* Design, implement, and optimize marketing automation workflows to improve campaign efficiency and personalization.
* Manage audience selection and activation within the Customer Data Platform (CDP).
* Provide training and ongoing support to global and regional teams to ensure effective use of segmentation and automation tools.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams including CRM, media, product, and analytics to align segmentation strategies with business goals.
* Monitor and analyze campaign performance, using insights and test & learn capabilities to refine segmentation and automation strategies to optimize ROI.
* Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and internal data governance standards.

  

  

**WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH**  

In this role, you’ll be part of the Measurement & Analytics team within the Marketing function and work closely with a wide range of stakeholders across the organization. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams within the marketing unit—including CRM, media operations, strategy and planning, controlling, and technical product teams—to ensure that segmentation and automation strategies are aligned with business goals and deliver measurable impact. Together, you’ll drive insights and execution that enhance marketing activations.

 **Qualifications** **WHO YOU ARE**

* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Analytics, Data Science, or a related field.
* 3–5 years of experience in CRM, marketing automation, or customer analytics.
* Hands-on experience with data activation tools (e.g., Hightouch) and marketing automation platforms (e.g., Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Adobe Campaign, Braze), with a strong understanding of how to connect data to customer experiences
* Strong analytical skills and proficiency in tools such as SQL, Excel, or Google Analytics.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Experience supporting or training teams across different regions is a plus.
* A collaborative team player with a proactive mindset and a passion for customer-centric marketing in a fast-paced, global environment.

  

**Additional Information** **WHO WE ARE**  

H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.


We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.  



  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**  

At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.

* 25% Staff discount on all our H&M Group brands, both in stores and online (H&M, COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories and ARKET).
* H&M Incentive Program – HIP. Learn more about the program here.

  

  

**JOIN US**  

This is a permanent position based in Stockholm.


Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.


Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.
company_description: At H&M, we welcome you to be yourself and challenge you to grow and make a difference. Help us reimagine the future of an entire industry, making everyone look, feel & do good.

title: Service Owner AV Tech
description:
We are Strawberry. With over 245 hotels, 120 restaurants, 20 spas and more, we create thousands of experiences every day. With urban Comfort Hotel®, warm Quality Hotel™, stylish Clarion Hotel® and cosy Home Hotel and more than 40 unique independent hotels, our guests can pick and choose. Our team of 20,000 passionate individuals from more than 120 countries is what makes us grow! Strawberry is built on our core values: energy, courage and enthusiasm.*At Strawberry, we're on a quest to redefine the hospitality experience through innovation & technology. In 2023 we launched our new mother brand, Strawberry, and we are transforming from a traditional hotel company to a universe of offers and experiences for our guests and customers.*



Do you thrive on optimizing systems and processes to drive business value?
  

We are seeking a dedicated **Service Owner AV Tech** to take full ownership of our in-room entertainment, digital signage, and AV services across our 250+ hotels.



This is a role where you will bridge the gap between business needs and technical solutions, ensuring our systems are not just functional, but truly elevate the guest journey and support our operational excellence.


**What You'll Do:**
-------------------



You will be the go-to expert for our key guest-facing technologies. Your responsibilities will include:


* **Service Ownership & Optimization**: Take full accountability for the performance, quality, and continuous improvement of our In-Room Entertainment, Digital Signage, and AV services. You'll establish best practices for setup and rollout, and drive ongoing optimization in close collaboration with partners.
* **Strategic System Development:** Align current service choices with our long-term vision, exploring ways to optimize utilization and ensuring future systems are cloud-based. You'll advise on strategic implementations, considering each hotel's unique needs.
* **Vendor Management:** Manage relationships with key technology vendors, actively participating in contract negotiations to secure the best terms and conditions.
* **Technical Advisor:** Serve as an advisor for business and internal projects related to these systems, ensuring implementation and seamless integrations.
* **Support Escalation**: Ensure the quality of our services. Act as a higher-level support resource for complex cases, facilitating communication and collaboration between our support team and external providers.
* **Performance Analysis & Improvement**: Secure monitoring and Service Level Agreements, analyzing service performance and translating insights into actionable improvements.
* **Stakeholder Collaboration:** Work closely with hotels, internal technology teams, partners, and vendors to ensure requirements are understood, properly implemented, and validated.
* **Innovation & Opportunities:** Identify new opportunities to enhance current services and proactively address future business needs.

  


**Who You Are:**
----------------


* You are a proactive, structured, and collaborative individual with a technical and business understanding.
* A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Engineering, Business Administration and Leadership, or equivalent relevant experience.
* Experience as a Service Owner, Business Analyst or Product Owner in relevant fields
* Great communication skills, both written and verbal
* Excellent active listening skills and a deep understanding of business processes.
* A strong ability to establish and maintain robust relationships.
* Great work capacity, able to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.
* A structured approach to problem-solving, coupled with strong people skills.
* Good understanding of English, both written and oral.
* Knowledge of ITIL and Scrum is an advantage.
* Knowledge of Project Management is an advantage.

  


**What We Offer:**
------------------


**Real Impact**: Be a part of a dynamic transformation and contribute directly to our success story.


**Empowerment:** Work in a flat organization with trust, autonomy, and the opportunity to make a real difference.


**Growth & Development:** Access professional development opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career.


**Fun & Community**: Enjoy a vibrant work environment with plenty of social events and team-building activities.


**Fantastic Perks:** Benefit from great employee discounts, including staff and friends & family rates at our hotels.


**Flexible Work**: Embrace a hybrid working model with your base at our HQ in Oslo or Stockholm.

  


#### **Sounds interesting?**


*Great, because we would love to get to know you too! Bring your individuality and your potential, Strawberry welcomes all!*
company_description: We are Strawberry. With over 225 hotels, 120 restaurants, 20 spas and more, we create thousands of experiences every day. Join a world of experiences!

title: Systems Technology Development Engineer, Lund
description:
Job Title
Systems Technology Development Engineer, Lund
Job Description*At Axis Communications we are passionate about creating a smarter and safer world! Part of this is enabling our partners in building complex systems including Axis products and solutions. We are looking forward to advance this field within our industry. Our success is largely due to highly skilled staff and our strong culture. Join our team and together we will move the boundaries of technology. We are looking for a Systems Technology Engineer & Proof of Concept Developer* *to join our Core Technologies – Systems team at our HQ in Lund, Sweden.*  

Who is your future team?
Don’t just see the big picture, paint it!
As part of the Core Technologies – Systems (CTS) team you will be collaborating with people across the entire Axis organization in order to ensure our ability to deliver new and exciting products and solutions that make the world a smarter and safer place. Advances in fields such as connectivity, IoT, Cloud Computing, SW development and AI are rapidly changing how our solutions and products are developed, used and integrated with other systems. Understanding the opportunities and challenges associated with these technical fields is a central part of our mission to empower both Axis R&D and our partners to outperform the competition.
What you’ll do here as System Technology Development Engineer
By combining Axis solutions with external platforms and solutions we can solve complex challenges within IoT, security, safety and operational efficiency. Working with next generation systems often means combining a diverse set of tools, components and solutions. We do this by building proof of concepts which means both learning about new technologies and a lot of hands-on development. An ability to pass on what you have learned and demonstrate the use of your work is also key, as is the ability to collaborate with experts in other fields to develop solutions involving many types of products and technologies. Typical assignments include:* Proof of concept system development
* New API-technology investigations and development
* Development of software orchestration and containerized deployment technology


Who are we looking for/Who are you?
You have a programming background and an interest to learn new programming languages and techniques.
For this role we believe you have a technical master’s degree and professional experience from system integration, development of proof of concepts or cyber physical systems. You are a doer that solves complex technical problems while keeping the big picture in mind. Experience with system development on wireless/mobile networks is a bonus but not a requirement. As part of the CTS team you will have an opportunity to push the boundaries of system technology while developing your own skills together with the team. We also believe that you are inspired by working with future technology on a 3-5 year horizon.
What Axis has to offer  

By joining Axis, you will embark on an exciting journey of personal and professional growth. We will offer you a great introduction to Axis with training. Our team will support you but also listen to your experiences and give you freedom to explore and realize your ideas. We are a fast-growing company that can offer you great career opportunities and a competitive package of benefits.  

In exchange for your dedication, Axis offers you a job in an open, friendly, and professional environment. We work in an innovative and global organization that takes great pride in delivering world-class, high-quality products, services, and solutions to our customers. Working with us gives you an excellent opportunity to develop in an organization promoting professional and individual growth. You will have a role where your operational effort really will be of great impact to the overall success of Axis.  

We want you to enjoy working with us, which is why we offer benefits such as flexible working hours, Friday cake, company bonus, wellness allowance, health insurance and your very own Axis bicycle - to name a few.  

We also provide a brand new training facility free for every Axis employee. You can see it here Axis HQ
We believe in sustainability, equality and inclusion. Read more here  

Axis is an organization that values creativity and promotes teamwork and openness. With us you will grow both personally and professionally. You will be part of a team of great colleagues that enjoy going to work in the morning. Welcome!  

Curious to discover more?  

We have a host of places where you can learn more about Axis, our products, solutions, company culture, and what working at Axis is really like.  

Check out:
Life at Axis blog
Engineering at Axis blog
Innovation at Axis
At Axis, we truly value work-life balance, and during the summer months, many of us take the opportunity to enjoy a well-deserved vacation. This might mean that our response times are a bit slower than usual — but rest assured, we’ll get back to you as soon as we can. In the meantime, we hope you’re also enjoying the season. Have a fantastic summer!
Ready to Act?  

Axis is a company realizing the benefits of a diverse workforce. We know that diversity in groups creates a better working environment and promotes creativity, something that is fundamental for our success. If you have additional questions, please contact the hiring Manager, Fredrik Herzberg Tel: +46 46 272 18 00
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2025-07-24*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 5000 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast
company_description: Axis Communications is a global growth company with currently are about 4000 employees worldwide and offices in over 50 countries. We are expanding. Visit our webb page axis.com

title: Guest Service Agent/Receptionist deltid till Gothia Towers & Upper House
description:
**Gothia Towers är en plats för möten och upplevelser för människor från hela världen. Ett fyrstjärnigt hotell med 1200 smakfullt inredda rum och magnifik utsikt över staden samt flera populära restauranger och barer med något för alla smaker. Här finns över 40 000 kvadratmeter upplevelseyta för fest, evenemang, show, konferens och kongress – allt under ett tak. Gothia Towers är en del av Svenska Mässan Gothia Towers.**

**Om rollen**  

I Guest Service välkomnar du gästen redan vid entrén och är behjälplig med det mesta. Arbetsuppgifterna är väldigt varierande och kan bestå i allt ifrån parkeringsservice, till att boka bord på restaurang, boka biljetter till en föreställning, bagageservice och diverse turistinformation. Guest Service ansvarar också för att hålla lobby och receptionsområde i bästa skick och letar hela tiden efter tillfällen att överträffa gästens förväntningar! För att jobba i Guest Service så måste man ha haft B-körkort i minst 1,5 år och känna sig bekväm med att köra andras bilar.


I vår organisation finns även vårt systerhotell Upper House och vi jobbar sammansvetsat som ett och samma team. Det betyder att man som anställd inom Guest Service Gothia Towers och Upper House, kan och förväntas arbeta på båda enheter.


I rollen som hotellreceptionist på Upper House kommer du att möta våra gäster vid ankomst, servera en välkomstdrink och boka/rekommendera aktiviteter som Göteborg har att erbjuda. Vi jobbar med varm och personlig service där gästen är i högsta fokus. Arbetet förutsätter att du är bekväm med att leverera service i världsklass samt ansvara för att våra gäster har det bra från det att de checkar in till dess att de lämnar hotellet. Arbetet innebär även dagligt receptionsarbete såsom in- och utcheckning samt merförsäljning. Till arbetsuppgifterna ingår även att kvalitetssäkra att standard och koncept följs.

**Vem är du?**  

Du har ett högt engagemang och du trivs med att jobba i team. Vi ser att du är driven, strukturerad och noggrann. Du gillar att ge service på hög nivå och är lyhörd för vad gästen vill ha. Du tycker om att arbeta i ett högt tempo och kan ta tag i arbetsuppgifter där det behövs. Du är medveten om, och bekväm i, att din roll är en viktig del i gästens upplevelse. Service är en genuin egenskap hos dig och du vill vara med och bedriva ett ”värdskap i världsklass”.


Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet från receptionsarbete på hotell, men även andra delar av hotell- och servicebranschen är meriterande. Du kan uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift, både på svenska och engelska. Har du arbetat med bokningssystemet Opera Cloud tidigare är det ett plus. Vi sätter stort värde på att intresse och engagemang finns och personlig lämplighet är avgörande.

**Varför ska du välja oss?**  

Vi på Svenska Mässan Gothia Towers är ett stort och sammansvetsat team med positiva och sociala kollegor. Med mycket glädje, mod och engagemang jobbar vi tätt ihop för att ge den bästa helhetsupplevelsen till våra miljontals besökare. Varje dag. Året om. Det är roligt att gå till jobbet eftersom vi får bidra till att skapa den mest attraktiva mötesplatsen i Europa. I vår dynamiska verksamhet finns mycket erfarenhet och kunskap inom olika yrkesområden. Eftersom vi har så många olika verksamheter finns ett stort antal möjligheter som kan sträcka sig över en hel karriär.

**Information om tjänsten**  

Det är flera anställningar som ska tillsättas, både tillsvidare-tjänst och vikariat på både 80% och 20%. Arbetstiderna varierar och är förlagd varannan helg, både dagtid och kvällstid. Tjänsterna på 80% innebär även arbete på vardagar. Sista ansökningsdag är 4 juli men sänd gärna din ansökan omgående.


Vid frågor kontakta Amanda Holgersson, Guest Service Manager Gothia Towers & Upper House, amanda.holgersson@gothiatowers.com

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

*Från hjärtat av Göteborg erbjuder Svenska Mässan Gothia Towers allt från stora mässor och event till oförglömliga hotell- och restaurangupplevelser. Vår verksamhet innefattar många starka varumärken som tillsammans skapar en unik och attraktiv mötesplats där vi varje år välkomnar nästan två miljoner besökare. Som medarbetare hos oss jobbar du tillsammans med ett stort, engagerat och sammansvetsat gäng och är med och utvecklar vår verksamhet, både nu och för framtiden. Inom Svenska Mässan Gothia Towers strävar vi efter en mångfald hos våra medarbetare och vi arbetar aktivt för att främja en inkluderande kultur. Bli en del av vår värld – det är här vi skapar upplevelser för livet.*  

*Läs mer om oss på www.svenskamassan.se och www.gothiatowers.com.*

*Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: deltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 6 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 20-80% | Ort: Göteborg | Län: Västra Götalands län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/49 | Kontakt: Amanda Holgersson 031-7508828, | Publicerat: 2025-06-27 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-07-04*

title: Major Account Executive, New and Existing Accounts
description:
**Would you like the opportunity to work in a dynamic sales role?**

**Do you love selling high value innovative solutions to customers?**

**Join our Nordic Sales team!**

At Akamai, we partner with Global 500 enterprises to deliver secure, high-performance digital experiences. Our Nordic sales team is at the forefront, working hand-in-hand with our customers to solve complex challenges and unlock growth. We don't just sell solutions we build long-term relationships, uncover business insights, and maximize value across our powerful global platform.


**Drive Growth. Close Strategic Deals. Elevate Global Brands**

You will own and grow a portfolio of key enterprise customers across the Nordic region. This is a high-impact, high-visibility role focused on both expanding existing relationships and landing new, strategic logos. You will act as a trusted advisor, driving value by aligning customer challenges with our cutting-edge platform.


As a Major Account Executive, you will be responsible for:


* Acquiring new customers. Identify and close new logo opportunities that align with our ideal customer profile.
* Growing existing accounts. Drive account expansion by identifying whitespace, upselling and cross-selling across Akamai's portfolio.
* Owning the sales cycle. From pipeline generation to close and renewal.
* Forecasting & reporting. Maintain an accurate and healthy pipeline, deliver reliable monthly and quarterly forecasts.
* Working with integrated cross-functional teams and partners ensuring your customers realise the value of their Akamai services.

**Do what you love**

To be successful in this role you will:


* Have relevant sales experience working with large enterprise customers in the Nordic market.
* Have proven experience selling enterprise SaaS, cybersecurity, or cloud-based technology solutions.
* Have a true hunter's mentality, with a track record of acquiring and growing major accounts.
* Have experience engaging with C-level/senior stakeholders in large enterprises and deep understanding of strategic account management.
* Demonstrate a good understanding of technology and the Internet, including cybersecurity or willingness to learn.
* Have good written and verbal communication skills, speak Swedish and fluency in English.

**Build your career at Akamai**

Our ability to shape digital life today relies on developing exceptional people like you. The kind that can turn impossible into possible. We’re doing everything we can to make Akamai a great place to work. A place where you can learn, grow and have a meaningful impact.


With our company moving so fast, it’s important that you’re able to build new skills, explore new roles, and try out different opportunities. There are so many different ways to build your career at Akamai, and we want to support you as much as possible. We have all kinds of development opportunities available, from programs such as GROW and Mentoring, to internal events like the APEX Expo and tools such as Linkedin Learning, all to help you expand your knowledge and experience here.


**Learn more**

Not sure if this job is the right match for you or want to learn more about the job before you apply? Schedule a 15-minute exploratory call with the Recruiter and they would be happy to share more details.
company_description: At Akamai, we make life better for billions of people, trillions of times a day.

**Flexible Work**: Embrace a hybrid working model with your base at our HQ in Oslo or Stockholm.

  


**Sounds interesting?**


*Great, because we would love to get to know you too! Bring your individuality and your potential, Strawberry welcomes all!*

title: Line Manager
description:
Göteborg,Västra Götaland,Sweden
Job ID**768542**
Join our Team
**About this opportunity:**

 **Become Ericsson’s next Line Manager: Be a part of leading real-world telecom innovation, shape critical infrastructure, and make a lasting impact on how people connect every day!**

  

  

In this role you will be a 1st line manager and your main tasks will be to secure Ericsson technology leadership and make sure that we have the right Equipment and Resource Handling product to secure Ericsson’s long- and short-term objectives. You will mentor, challenge and develop individuals, teams and the organization, influencing a creative and learning culture.  

A large part of your work will be spent in tight co-operation in your section and our leadership team, and with other parts of Ericsson. This requires a keen interest in people and an ability to empower teams. We also expect you to have the gift and courage of simplifying complex structures, to develop competence and innovation.

  

You must have a good understanding of agile and lean R&D development. You will be interested in the quality and evolvement of our product and the programs that we contribute to. Our product is developed by many teams on different sites and in different programs.

 **What will you do**

* Lead and mentor 2-3 cross-functional development teams of software engineers and related roles.
* Contribute to the roadmap and quality of the CAT ERC product (Common Architecture Tier – Equipment and Resource Control), aligning with overall business objectives.
* Create a culture of collaboration and end-to-end perspective from systemization to verification in the teams.
* Be an active contributor in our geographically wide leadership team with focus on both your section and our department perspectives.
* Drive continuous improvements.

 **The skills you bring**

* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
* Experience in software development, with a proven track record of leadership and product ownership.
* Significant experience in leading cross functional design teams, ensuring seamless collaboration in a fast-paced and agile environment.
* A strong business mindset and to drive and reach the objectives and targets set for your unit.
* Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills in English.
* Understanding of 5G NR, LTE RAN technologies and Cloud RAN architectures is a plus.

 **The characteristics we are looking for**


As a person you constantly seek to create the right working conditions, developing and driving a culture of learning, through coaching and mentoring the people within your teams. Your positive energy and genuine “yes-we-can” attitude helps driving people, diversity, competence, culture and ways of working forward. You’re a leader who creates common goals, vision and engage members of our leadership group, bringing a strong product focus to strategic discussions.

  

If you think this opportunity sounds interesting and sounds like you? – Then apply!


We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.


Last application date: 14/7-2024

**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**
company_description: Do you want to be part of shaping the future? From making connectivity more accessible to the latest IoT solutions, you have an opportunity to be where it begins.

title: Product Line Manager Analytics Platform
description:
Stockholm,Stockholm,Sweden
Job ID**768804**
Join our Team
**About the Opportunity**

  

If you are passionate about AI and Analytics adoption and thrive on driving innovation, this opportunity is for you! Ericsson Enterprise IT is transforming business by embedding digital expertise across the company to accelerate innovation, resilience, and growth through secure, scalable platforms that unlock the value of data, AI, automation, and cloud technologies. As a strategic partner, we build a future-proof foundation that protects assets, empowers teams, and shapes a dynamic digital workplace to enable Ericsson’s leadership in a fast-evolving global market.

  

We seek a Product Line Manager for the Data Analytics Platform to shape and execute strategic plans for sustainable growth. Reporting to the Product Area Manager for Enablement Platforms (L4 level), you will contribute directly to leadership teams and strategic initiatives.

  

Your main responsibility is leading the future development of data platforms and visualization. The Product Line Data Analytics Platform supports Ericsson’s digital transformation by delivering secure, compliant, efficient, and future-proof solutions. You will lead a diverse team across Sweden and India specializing in data platforms, analytics, and visualization, leveraging cloud-native technologies and AI to convert raw data into actionable insights.

 **What You Will Do**

* Own the Product Line Data Analytics Platform and its performance.
* Align deliverables with business strategy and prioritize initiatives with stakeholders to maximize value.
* Manage execution across the Product Line to meet business outcomes.
* Ensure integration between data platforms, analytics, and visualization technologies.
* Lead planning cycles to align investments with outcomes and meet OKRs.
* Oversee IT product owners to ensure portfolio ownership throughout lifecycles, adhering to architecture and security standards.
* Guide portfolio roadmaps aligned with centralized prioritization.
* Reimagine data-to-insight workflows using advanced technologies.
* Foster innovation culture.
* Build strong relationships with business and IT leaders.
* Mentor IT Product Managers and Specialists, supporting transformation initiatives.
 **The Skills You Bring**

* MBA, MSc, or equivalent experience.
* 10+ years of proven leadership in similar roles.
* Deep understanding of Ericsson’s business and expertise in Product or Customer Management.
* Strong knowledge of Data Platforms, Analytics, and Visualization from both business and technical perspectives.
* Proven track record delivering business results and leading transformational initiatives.
* Thorough understanding of digital transformation, especially in Data Platforms, Analytics, Visualization, and AI applications in Data Engineering.
* Strong leadership and stakeholder engagement skills.
* Passion for leading and developing people.
* Critical thinking and thought leadership.
* Excellent collaboration and knowledge-sharing skills.
**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**

title: Receptionist Scandic Järva Krog
description:
\*\*Scandic Järva Krog\*\* är en välkänd byggnad för de som kör E4an norr- eller söderut. Nära oss ligger Ulriksdal, Hagaparken, Strawberry Arena och Mall of Scandinavia. Bra kommunikationer gör det lätt att ta sig hit! Vi är ett familjärt hotell och tillsammans arbetar vi mot vår vision: Det personliga hotellet med DIG och gästen i fokus. Vi erbjuder våra medarbetare en välkomnande och varm arbetsplats i ett härligt och glatt team, där våra chefer arbetar nära sina medarbetare. Älskar du också det personliga mötet med gästen? Då är du den vi söker!


**Nu söker vi en Receptionist till Scandic Järva Krog.**



Oavsett varför gästen kommer till oss är det få saker som är så uppskattade som ett vänligt ansikte som hälsar välkommen. Du agerar värd tillsammans med övriga teamet på hotellet och skapar en gästupplevelse i världsklass.



Hos oss får du ta ett stort eget ansvar för att ta de beslut som krävs för att göra gästen nöjd och teamen utvecklar och förbättrar arbetssätt och service i takt med att omvärlden förändras. Vi är nämligen övertygade om att det är när du får utvecklas och bidra med all din kompetens och erfarenhet som vi överträffar gästens förväntningar. På köpet får vi kul på jobbet!



Så ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss – och bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic!


**Vad är innebär rollen?**



Du som arbetar i receptionen är ansvarig för att våra gäster får service i världsklass. Du är spindeln i nätet som ser till att gästen alltid är i fokus. Du är den som går igenom ankomstlistan och lägger tid på detaljerna. Ser till att gästens önskemål uppfylls. Du har alltid ett leende på läpparna och en kreativ lösning i bakfickan. Du löser det mesta och är en stjärna på att vända en missnöjd gäst till en nöjd gäst. Din arbetsplats är vår lobby. För det är där du möter flest gäster. I ansvarsområdet ingår även administrativt arbete, säkerhetsarbete och arbete med försäljning.


Arbetet i receptionen innebär att checka in och ut hotellets gäster, hälsa välkommen och ge gästen den information den behöver om sin vistelse. Du hanterar bokningar i systemet Opera Cloud och hanterar administrativa uppgifter runt gäster och säkerhet. Allt arbete sker med gästnöjdhet och försäljning i fokus.


Hotellet har öppet dygnet runt och det är därför viktigt att du trivs med att arbeta i skift (förmiddagar, eftermiddagar, kvällar och helger).


**Vem är du?**



För att passa i rollen tror vi att du har en väl utvecklad social förmåga och är kapabel att hantera att det händer många olika saker samtidigt. Det är mycket viktigt att du kan förmedla ett gott värdskap till hotellets gäster.



Du har också vana och kunskap i att arbeta med dator som arbetsredskap.


Eftersom arbetet till stor del består av att kommunicera med gäster är goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska en förutsättning. Talar du ytterligare ett språk är det meriterande.


Allra viktigast är dock dina personliga egenskaper och din inställning. För att passa i rollen behöver du vara en lyhörd och prestigelös lagspelare som tar ett stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och helhetsresultatet.


**Information om tjänsten**



Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på deltid.


Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vår hemsida. Alla ansökningar kommer att behandlas löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, varför vi ber dig att ansöka så snart som möjligt. I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av ett enklare test om service vid urvalet.



Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till oss på Scandic!



Ps. på vår hemsida kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, vad tjänsten innebär och om våra förmåner!


  
**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------

Rabatt när du äter, dricker och övernattar hos oss


Family & Friends rabatt för din familj och vänner


Rabatt hos våra partnerföretag


Pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal


Friskvårdsbidrag


Utbildning och utveckling via interna plattformar


  
Vi når längre när olikheter bejakas. Hos oss får du utrymme att vara dig själv och utvecklas i den riktning du vill, med trygga villkor och schyssta avtal som grund. Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic.



Delar du våra värderingar?


**BE A PRO** **BE YOU** **BE CARING** **BE BOLD**

  

  

...uppmuntrar alla att göra skillnad för miljön och att det var en av våra kollegor inom housekeeping som kom på idén om ”häng-upp-handduken”.
...i Sverige blivit rankad som besöksnäringens mest attraktiva arbetsgivare två år i rad, i Visitas årliga undersökning.
... bara serverar kaffe som är ekologiskt och Fairtrade eller UTZ-certifierat.
...tack vare vårt stora miljöengagemang, blivit rankad som branschens mest hållbara arbetsgivare elva år i rad, av Sustainable Brand Index.
...under 2014 inledde ett samarbete med organisationen Real Stars, centrerat kring ”Fair Sex”, dvs. arbete mot människo- och sexhandel.
company_addresses:
Scandic Hotels Deutschland GmbH
Gabriele-Tergit-Promenade 19
10963 Berlin
company_description: Nordiskt hotellföretag i världsklass som skapar enastående upplevelser för de många människorna. 16 000 medarbetar, 280 hotell i 6 länder.

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
Description
  
  

Are you driven by innovation and looking to thrive in a fast-paced, growing environment? Join us at Calabrio and be part of our dynamic team! Help us in reshaping the landscape of customer experience - where every interaction becomes an opportunity, and every insight drives meaningful change.
  
  

Introducing Calabrio - The trailblazers in customer experience intelligence! Revolutionizing the way organizations connect with their customers, we empower businesses to elevate every interaction to new heights. Our cutting-edge cloud platform, coupled with AI-driven analytics tools, unlocks the true essence of customer sentiment, turning data into actionable insights with lightning speed.
  
  

Calabrio is seeking a high touch, enterprise level Customer Success Manager to join our growing Revenue organization! In this role, the CSM is directly accountable for your customers' successful product deployment, adoption, retention, and advocacy. The right candidate is an expert relationship builder and deeply understands their customers' business models, core problems, and critical use cases. If you are technically savvy, love building relationships, are solutions oriented, thrive on wowing customers, and will go above-and-beyond to serve our customers, this role is for you!
  
  

**What you'll be doing:**  

Customer Engagement
  
Act as a business partner to the customer.
  
Present to stakeholders the opportunities and usage of the contact center. Engaged with all levels in the customer business.
  
Conduct stakeholder mapping and decision maker analysis, fostering close relationships with the identified individuals.
  
Promote expansive thinking and progressive strategies within the contact center environment.
  
Adoption of Product
  
Drive adoption to Calabrio products to insure depth of knowledge and expansion within the product portfolio.
  
Align customer needs with solutions offered by the product suite.
  
Provide recommendations for next steps and long-term strategies.
  
Sales
  
Identify and close upsell/cross-sell opportunities.
  
Retain and renew customers.
  
Create advocates for Calabrio; Referenceable accounts, case study participants, etc.
  
Internal Influencer
  
Partner across internal Calabrio experts to provide additional consulting/sales/demonstration of products. Recognize when to engage subject matter experts.
  
Requirements
  
Bachelor's degree or equivalent, relevant working experience.
  
5+ years of Account Management, Business Development, Customer Success or similar background, preferably within a SaaS organization.
  
Knowledge and experience of the contact center space, 1 or more of the WFO products (WFM, QM, Analytics or Reporting).
  
Consultative style and approach. Ability to understand needs of customer and translate into practical application(s).
  
Sales solutions - identify needs and support the expansion of the customer.
  
Ability to forecast expansion opportunities and business impact.
  
Internal influence, collaboration to achieve results.
  
Financial & contract acumen to manage core accounts, account receivables, terms and conditions of contracts.
  
Proactive and professional communication.
  
**Languages required:** English and Swedish (Finnish, Danish, and Norwegian are a plus).
  
Benefits
  
  

**Calabrio People are:** Open, Clear, Ambitious, Accountable, Collaborative, Consistent
  
  

What we value most…workplace diversity and ensuring an environment of mutual respect. We believe that diversity and inclusion are critical to our success, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Our commitment is to continue to keep our people healthy, focused, and inspire creativity. Our team members are offered comprehensive benefits for various life circumstances and needs, great opportunities for career development, and a balanced work-life to achieve personal and professional success (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). As an Innovator with Purpose, you’ll feel motivated and genuinely excited to come to work!
  
  

Calabrio celebrates and fosters a culture that thrives on diversity. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer that prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. We provide employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Calabrio are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status, parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We celebrate the >40 nationalities of team members that contribute to our success.
  
  

Ready for Exponential Career Opportunities? Apply now
company_description: Calabrio has joined forces with some of the best minds and most progressive concepts on enriching human interactions through our customer experience intelligence platform.
ceo_name: Joel Martins, Interim CEO and CTO

title: Nätverkskonsult
description:
Har du ett öga för nätverkslösningar och gillar att jobba nära kund? Drivs du av att arbeta med stora, spännande projekt där din insats verkligen gör skillnad? Då vill jag gärna lära känna dig! Jag heter David Johansson och ansvarar för vår fantastiska konsultgrupp i Göteborg . Vi växer och söker en ny kollega i rollen som **Nätverkskonsult** som vill vara med på vår gemensamma resa mot framtidens digitala infrastruktur!


**Är det här din nästa möjlighet?**

I rollen som Nätverkskonsult hos oss blir du en viktig spelare i allt från planering och design till installation, konfiguration och felsökning av nätverks- och säkerhetslösningar.


Du kommer att jobba både självständigt och i nära samarbete med andra specialister inom våra tre fokusområden: nätverk, säkerhet och hybrid IT. Här får du chansen att dyka djupt ner i tekniken, utforska nya lösningar och samla inspiration från både Cloud och on- prem . Och vet du vad? Om du på sikt vill certifiera dig inom fler områden så står vi redo att stötta dig hela vägen!


**Är det här du?**

Du är en person som gillar att arbeta i ett högt tempo och har en naturlig förmåga att engagera både kunder och kollegor. Du älskar att brainstorma idéer och har en förmåga att förvandla krav till konkreta, genomförbara lösningar. Dessutom är du nyfiken på att växa och utvecklas i din karriär – och vi är här för att hjälpa dig på den resan!


Vi ser gärna att du har:


* Några års erfarenhet inom routing och switching
* Erfarenhet inom Cisco, Fortinet och/eller Aruba ses som meriterande
* Har genomgått en nätverksutbildning, exempelvis på Yrkeshögskola (YH) eller motsvarande
Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift  

* 
**Varför** **Telia** **Cygate** **?**

På Telia Cygate är vi inte bara experter på nätverk, säkerhet och olika slags moln – vi är också ett gäng som tycker att det ska vara kul att gå till jobbet! Som en del av Telia Company har vi styrkan att skapa verklig påverkan i stor skala, bidra till samhällsnytta och hjälpa våra kunder att navigera i digitaliseringens värld. Vi gör det alltid med värme, omtanke och ett leende. Här är det idéerna och våra olika perspektiv som gör oss starka, och tillsammans ser vi till att teknikens värld blir en plats där alla trivs – och där du hör hemma.


Hos oss är din utveckling viktig. Vi uppmuntrar till kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och ser till att just du och dina intressen är i fokus. Vi vet att det är människorna som utgör vårt företag, och därför värdesätter vi glädje, kreativitet och olika perspektiv i allt vi gör.


Välkommen att växa tillsammans med oss, där vi gör teknik mänsklig och skapar verklig påverkan **!**  



**Låter det intressant?**

Ta chansen och bli en del av vårt härliga team! Tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan – vi ser fram emot att höra från dig. Sista ansökningsdag är **2025-0** **8-17**

Placeringsort: Göteborg


Har du frågor om tjänsten? Kontakta mig gärna, David Johansson på david.johansson@cygate.se eller via LinkedIn.


Bakgrundskontroll är en del i våra rekryteringsprocesser.  



**Välkommen** **till Telia** **Cygate** **– Home of Experts**

title: Information Architect - Data Governance
description:
We are looking for an **Information Architect** to join our Business Intelligence & Information Management team in **Helsinki** or **Sweden**. You will join a growing team supporting the rapid growth of RELEX by providing data, information and insight to fuel decision making and business process improvement.



As an Information Architect, you will work closely with our business stakeholders and Enterprise Architecture to ensure that information requirements are captured and modelled in alignment with the organization's goals and objectives. Your role will be integral to establishing smooth collaboration with various Information, Data and System Owners, as well as data consumers, such as Data Engineers and Analysts.


**Your main responsibilities will be:**


* Information Architecture Design: Develop and maintain the RELEX' information architecture framework, including models, taxonomies, and metadata
* Strategy Alignment: Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure the architecture supports business objectives and aligns with data governance policies
* Development and maintenance of RELEX' common information model and glossary as an implementation independent target view for business information
* User-Centered Design: Create and maintain intuitive navigation structures for information retrieval and usability, keeping end-user needs in mind
* Governance and Compliance: Establish standards and best practices for data management, ensuring compliance with regulations (e.g., GDPR, ISO 27001)
* Documentation and Communication: Produce clear documentation of architectures, workflows, and processes to support internal and external stakeholders
* Guide value creation with an information centric approach, supporting the company in the topics in information management, information models, data models, master data management and data integration
* Collaboration: Working closely with subject matter experts to design conceptual, logical and business process models; actively engage with development teams to implement models and guide specific technology and solution specific designs
* System Integration: Work with IT teams to design scalable information systems and ensure seamless integration between platforms and tools
* Continuous Improvement: Assess and optimize existing information systems to improve efficiency, reduce redundancy, and enhance usability

**What you'll bring to the table:**


* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Enterprise Modeling, Information Systems, or a related field. A master's degree is a plus.
* Proven experience (5+ years) in information architecture, data modeling, or related roles.

**Technical skills:**


* Proficiency in data modeling tools and techniques
* Experience with databases (SQL and NoSQL), metadata management, and taxonomy development
* Familiarity with cloud platforms and data integration technologies
* Proficiency in conceptual modeling tools and techniques
* Knowledge of enterprise architecture frameworks (e.g., TOGAF, Zachman) is advantageous
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to explain complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders
* Attention to detail and a proactive approach to identifying opportunities for improvement

  

#### 

**Life at RELEX**



RELEX operates in diverse markets across the globe. As part of a truly international team, you'll collaborate across time zones and cultures, driving innovation and achieving shared success. Our modern approach ensures that work is meaningful, inclusive, and impactful no matter where you are.



Our workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all. We actively listen to our community to continuously improve our offerings, ensuring they remain relevant and valuable as we design and update them.


***Key Benefits***


* Flexible and hybrid working options to support work-life integration
* Comprehensive health and wellness initiatives
* Professional development opportunities, including training, mentorship, and clear career pathways
* Generous leave policies, including parental leave and paid time off, supporting both personal and professional priorities


Life at RELEX is defined by collaboration, respect, and flexibility. We believe in fostering a work environment where innovation thrives and everyone feels valued. Our teams work together to solve meaningful challenges, creating an inclusive culture that supports professional and personal growth. Whether you're engaging with colleagues across the globe or finding your own work-life balance, life at RELEX is about making a difference while enjoying the journey. What difference will you make?


#### **Are you the one we're looking for? Apply today and become a part of our RELEX family!**
company_description: RELEX Solutions helps retailers and consumer brands drive profitable growth across all sales and distribution channels by maximizing customer satisfaction and minimizing operative costs.

title: Product Engineer – Wireless
description:
Location: Stockholm or Gothenburg

Duration: 2 years

We are looking for an experienced Product Engineer – Wireless to lead the strategy, design, and delivery of next-generation wireless network services for a global enterprise environment. You will be part of a highly skilled and collaborative team, working closely with stakeholders across IT, cybersecurity, cloud infrastructure, and operations.

This role is ideal for a senior professional who thrives in complex, fast-moving environments and has a strong track record of delivering scalable wireless solutions in large organizations.

Scope of Responsibilities

Define and drive the wireless network vision and strategy in collaboration with stakeholders and technical teams.

Own high-level and low-level design of wireless network solutions across global enterprise environments.

Lead the end-to-end planning and deployment of wireless technologies, with a focus on scalability, security, and user experience.

Oversee solution roadmaps and align wireless capabilities with long-term business and IT strategy.

Partner with cross-functional teams to ensure wireless infrastructure supports evolving digital and operational needs.

Guide vendor relationships and ensure value realization from products and services.

Contribute to transformation projects including smart factories, IoT environments, and multi-tenant implementations.

Required Expertise

Deep technical knowledge in wireless technologies: 802.11, WiFi 6/6E, LTE, DAS, Private 5G.

Experience with enterprise wireless design, including campus and industrial networks.

Hands-on expertise with Cisco and Ruckus Wireless solutions.

Proficiency with wireless site survey tools (Ekahau) for passive, active, and predictive surveys.

Proven experience in wireless network design for performance and scalability.

Understanding of OT/factory networks and integration with IoT ecosystems.

Familiarity with cloud connectivity: Direct Connect, ExpressRoute, Cloud Exchange.

Experience in captive portal integration and wireless access control (dot1x, EAP-TLS, FlexConnect).

Ability to produce high-quality design documentation (HLD, LLD, CRD).

Strong experience in network testing: performance, security, and resilience validation.

Qualifications

Minimum 15 years of experience in networking, with at least 5 years focused on large-scale wireless solutions.

CCIE Wireless or equivalent certifications required.

ECSE Design certification is highly desirable.

Experience with SD-WAN, network security, and automation-first approaches.

Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.

Experience in strategic planning, project sequencing, and dependency mapping.

Track record of working with senior leadership and driving technology adoption.

Agile mindset and ability to lead in a global, matrixed organization.

This is a senior-level opportunity to make a significant impact on the future of enterprise wireless connectivity. You will be instrumental in shaping innovative and resilient infrastructure to support digital transformation at scale.

Interested candidates currently located in Stockholm or Gothenburg are encouraged to apply.

Job Type: Full-time

Work Location: In person

	+ Retain and renew customers.
	+ Create advocates for Calabrio; Referenceable accounts, case study participants, etc.
* Internal Influencer
* + Partner across internal Calabrio experts to provide additional consulting/sales/demonstration of products. Recognize when to engage subject matter experts.

* 5+ years of Account Management, Business Development, Customer Success or similar background, preferably within a SaaS organization.

* Ability to forecast expansion opportunities and business impact.
* Internal influence, collaboration to achieve results.
* Financial & contract acumen to manage core accounts, account receivables, terms and conditions of contracts.
* Proactive and professional communication.

Calabrio People are: Open, Clear, Ambitious, Accountable, Collaborative, Consistent

We celebrate the >40 nationalities of team members that contribute to our success.
